intro: Neonauclea maluensis, commonly known as the Maluensis Ironwood, is a tropical tree native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in lowland and montane rainforests, reaching heights of up to 20 meters. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Neonauclea maluensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
